I'm on the dhclient file already

when that file opens up you should see a line (commented out, means there is a # in front of it) goes like this > prepend domain-name-servers 127.0.0.1; -- uncomment it (remove the first #) and replace 127.0.0.1; with your dns server, for example 192.168.1.1;192.168.1.23; etc.

this will make it so whatever information you get from dhcp, these servers are always on top of the resolve order. You can also disable the option to get dns information from dhcp, but that might cause you problems down the road.
